title: Ticket #3102: classad int() function returns error for trailing spaces
description:
the classad int() function responds to whitespace in an unexpected way.

int("12345") returns 12345,

but

int("12345 ") returns error.

this function should not return an error if unless there are no digits in the input string. leading whitespace should be ignored, and any characters after valid digits should result in termination of parsing without an error.
remarks:
2012-Sep-11 11:06:53 by johnkn:
Bulk change of target version from v070803 to v070804 using ./ticket-target-mover.
2012-Sep-19 16:15:53 by zmiller:
Bulk change of target version from v070804 to v070805 using ./ticket-target-mover.

2012-Oct-02 16:48:09 by jfrey:
Trailing characters are ignored if the successfully-parsed number is followed by one of the defined numerical scaling characters (e.g. k, m, g).
2012-Oct-25 17:52:16 by johnkn:
Bulk change of target version from v070806 to v070807 using ./ticket-target-mover.
